channel.title: Piracy, copyright infringement and what not avoidable?
channel.description:
Could you get away with copyright e.g. you get reported and people get on your case but you think you safe behind another network such as a VPS but your providers would shut you VPS? Say they want to sue you? your VPS providers give you contact details including IP. Same with using a proxy, they could surely just keep going on, find the proxy provider and find the IP connected then work on that.
And you can keep trying... but my question is could you actually avoid/get away with it?

item.title: Piracy, copyright infringement and what not avoidable?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:9, topic:509399”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=627642.msg4265364#msg4265364 date=1363987545]
but my question is could you actually avoid/get away with it?
[/quote]

[quote author=Niall link=topic=627642.msg4267603#msg4267603 date=1364237551]

Yet people do it everyday!

people do it every day so that must mean it’s safe to use!

if you want a safe alternative DO NOT use paypal
[/quote]Guess I will have to say it again, people do it everyday. So yes Paypal as ruddy as it is works just fine for his cruel and illegal intentions. I hope that clears up his confusion.[/quote]
If you want to make a hard to trace path though, its a very smart idea not to deal with a highly traceable system.

Read full topic
item.source: Piracy, copyright infringement and what not avoidable?

@Ashi wrote:

frankly Paypal don’t give a shit, I was -$100 at 1 time and after a couple months the account just got locked. (luckily)

item.title: Piracy, copyright infringement and what not avoidable?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

if you want to make money off of copyright infringement but don’t know how to do it, the only advise I can give is DO NOT DO IT, if you do not know exactly what you are doing you can land in a serious world of shit very quickly

if you want to expand on what you’re doing you can get a better answer, but doing so will potentially incriminate you so again, if you don’t know exactly what you’re doing you shouldn’t bother

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:4, topic:509399”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=627642.msg4265792#msg4265792 date=1364040022]

Project TOR

Tor wasn’t designed for hosting though and still billing information’s traceable?
[/quote]If you pay through paypal (or have somebody else pay and you pay them) then there is no address being swapped.[/quote]

are you fucking retarded, money paid through paypal is absolutely traceable, doing anything with money on paypal that was illegally obtained is beyond ridiculous

Read full topic
